intro: Thapsia thapsioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slight aromatic scent, and it produces small, dry fruits that are dispersed by wind. Thapsia thapsioides is often found in open habitats such as slopes and coastal areas.
